FINAL DECREE OF DIVORCE
THIS CAUSE coming to be heard on the 15th day of November, 2023, for trial.
The Plaintiff was present with counsel, Tom F. Young, Jr. The Defendant was present
with counsel, Thomas A. Radney. Testimony was taken ore tenus. Based on the
pleadings and evidence and testimony presented, it is ORDERED, ADJUDGED and
DECREED as follows:
1. The paities shall be divorced on the grounds of incompatibility. The
Plaintiff is hereby forever DIVORCED from the Defendant.
2. That either patty may file an appeal within forty-two ( 42) days from the
date this decree is executed.
3. That neither party shall again marry except to each other until sixty ( 60)
days after the date of this decree.
4. If an appeal from this decree is taken within sixty (60) days, neither paity
shall marry again except to each other during the pendency of said appeal.
5. The paities shall live completely and separately apait, and neither patty
shall hereinafter in any way harass, threaten, intimidate, or otherwise act in any way to
obviously embatrnss or humiliate the other paity.
6. The mai·ital residence located at 536 Rocky Creek Road, Alexander City,
Alabama, shall be awarded to the Husband. He shall be responsible for all debts, taxes,
insurance, maintenance and expenses related to the prope1ty. The Wife shall be divested
of all rights, title and interest in the property. Upon receipt of the payment referenced
DOCUMENT 156
below, the Wife shall execute a Quit Claim Deed conveying her interest in the prope1ty to
the Husband,
7. The Husband shall pay to the Wife one-half (1/2) of the equity in the residence
which is fifty-one thousand four hundred eleven dollars and 21/100 ($51,411.21). This
amount shall be paid as follows: $10,000.00 within 10 days of this order, followed by
monthly payments of $2,000.00 per month for 21 consecutive months beginning April 1st.
The court is aware that the total of the payments above total $52,000.00. The additional
$588. 79 awarded may be avoided by the Husband by paying the full $51,411.21 within 90
days of this order. Othe1wise, the additional $588.79 shall be consideration for the delay in
the Wife receiving full payment. If the Husband fails to timely make these payments, then the
house shall be placed on the market for sale with a licensed real estate agent. Upon sale, the
net proceeds shall be equally divided between the parties.
8, The Wife shall be awarded the following personal prope1ty. She shall
provide the Husband notice of the date and time she plans to retrieve these items.
Master Bedroom:
a. White Best brand chair
b. ½ Wall decor
c. Lamps
Upstairs:
a, ½ ofMemory boxes
b, Cricut and supplies
C, TV 75"
d, End tables and coffee table
e. Kid's clothes/AK's dance clothes/DVDs
AK'sRoom:
a. Half of her clothing
b Half her dance awards
Bennett's Room:
a. Frame
b. Mattress and box springs
C, 2 nightstands
d. Dresser
e. Half of his clothing
f. ½ Memories in closet
DOCUMENT 156
g. Bedding and pillows
Playroom:
a. 2 white storage units
b. 2 framed silhouette pictures
c. Half of toys
d. Playmat
e. Anywhere chair
f. Train table
g. Bounce house
h. 1 toy box
1. Basketball hoop
Hall Closet:
a. Euro pillows
b. Beach items
c. Blankets
Living Room:
a. Sofa table and decor items/lamp
b. Credenza and decor items
c. Books
Kitchen:
a. Rae Dunn collections
b. Dutch oven
c. White Pioneer Woman dinnerware
d. White serving items/bowls
e. Christmas dinnerware
f. Kid's Christmas plates
g. Crockpots (big and 2 small)
h. Plant (my grandmother's lily plant)
Dining Room:
a. Brown shelf with Rae Dunn items
DOCUMENT 156
b. Rae Dunn and other decor on hutch
Outdoor:
a. 7-piece table and umbrella
b. Rug
Basement:
a. 2 highchairs
b. ½ Memory boxes
c. Christmas decor (Blaine keeps Grinch tree and decor)
d. Kid's Christmas decor
e. Fall decor
f. Easter decor
Miscellaneous:
a. Canon camera/Camcorder
9. The parties shall equally divide the dogs and puppies.
10. The Husband shall be awarded the furniture and personal prope1ty
located at the residence not specifically awarded to Wife.
11. The Wife shall be awarded the 2018 Acura MDX. The Husband shall pay
debt cmTent through February 29, 2024. Beginning March 1, 2024, the Wife shall
assume any debt associated therewith and shall hold the Husband harmless from any
liability for said indebtedness. She shall be responsible for the tags, taxes, insurance
and maintenance.
12. The Husband shall be awarded the 2015 Nissan Altima. He shall
assume any debt associated therewith and shall hold the Wife harmless from any
liability for said indebtedness. He shall be responsible for the tags, taxes, insurance,
and maintenance. The Husband is also awarded the Lawn mower and golf cart. He
shall pay all indebtedness thereon and hold the Wife harmless for payment thereof.
13. The paities are awarded joint legal custody of the minor children. The
Husband is awarded the physical custody of the minor children. The Wife shall have
visitation periods as follows: From picking up the children on Thursday at school until
taking the children back to school on the following Monday morning on the 1st and 3rd
weeks of each month. Joint legal custody means that both parents shall be involved in
DOCUMENT 156
the life of the child. Each shall have access to all educational, medical, religious and
social records/occmTences in the life of the child. Each shall have the right to make
appointments, consult and counsel with any educational or medical professionals
regarding the children. Each party shall have the right to participate in school
conferences, events and activities and the right to consult with teachers, school
personnel, medical and health care providers, psychologists, and other counselors who
are working with the minor children. Each party shall be listed as an emergency
contact for all schools and medical providers. The patties shall consult each other
regarding all major decisions. The Patties shall promptly inform the other parent of
any serious illness and/or injury to the children that requires medical attention. Each
Party shall provide the other with any medications the children are taking at the time
of visitation exchanges. Each party shall administer the medication as prescribed. Each
shall provide the other with sufficient infotmation to allow the other Party to obtain
refills of said medications. Each shall notify the other of any medical, educational,
religious, or social appointment or event and give the other the reasonable opportunity
to patticipate. Each Party shall execute any required documents to allow the other
Patty to access all medical or dental records of the children.
14. The Wife shall be allowed the following visitation as well:
a. For the months of June and July the 1st and 3rd full weeks, with
both children on a week on/week off basis exchanging on Fridays
at 6:00 p.m.
b. The parties shall alternate the Christmas holiday with the Mother
having even numbered years from December 18th at 6:00 p.m.
until December 25th at noon and the Father having odd numbered
years. The Mother shall have odd numbered years from December
25th at noon until January 1st at 6:00 p.m. and the Father having
even numbered years.
c. The parties shall alternate the Thanksgiving holiday with the
Father having even numbered years and the Mother having odd
numbered years. This visitation shall begin at 6:00 p.m. on
Wednesday and end at 6:00 p.m. the following Sunday.
DOCUMENT 156
d. Mother's Day/Father's Day: The minor children shall be with the
Mother on Mother's Day and with the Father on Father's Day
regardless of the specified visitation schedule from 9:00 a.m. to
6:00 p.m.
e. The patties shall alternate Spring break with the Wife having even
years and the Husband having odd years.
f. At times and places mutually agreed upon by the patties.
15. Each parent shall have the right to call or Facetime with the minor
children once a day while the children are with the other parent.
16. The Wife shall pay to the Husband the sum of$617.00 per month as child
suppott for the use and benefit of the minor children, by the 15th day of each month
beginning March 2024.
17. The Husband shall claim the children every year for income tax purposes.
18. The Father shall maintain health and dental insurance on the minor
children. Any medical, dental, vision or orthodontic expense for the children not covered
by insurance shall be equally divided between the patties. The paying patty shall notify
the other patty within 20 days of the expense incmTed; thereafter, the non-paying patty
shall reimburse the paying party its share within 14 days of being notified of the expense.
19. Each party shall retain any financial account, checking account, savings
account, retirement account, 401 (k), or the like upon which he/she is primary holder. The
other patty shall execute any document necessary to relinquish any right that he/she may
gave in said account.
20. Each party shall pay his/her own debt beginning the first month after the
signing oft his decree.
21. This Final Decree ofD ivorce including the provisions regarding child
custody and visitation are Court orders enforceable against the Husband and Wife. Each
is reminded that he/she is required to follow this order. As parents, each must assure that
the minor children follow this order, where applicable. Each must infonn his/her family
not to interfere or influence the terms of this order. If either patty willfully violated the
tetms of this order, he/she will be subject to sanctions, penalties and attorney's fees.
22. Neither party shall annoy, hai·ass, or alarm the other. Each shall
DOCUMENT 156
communicate with the other for the sole purpose of canying out the terms of this decree
or necessary issues regarding the children. Neither shall make any negative or
derogatmy comments to the other or in the presence of the children. Neither party shall
discuss this case or any legal proceeding between the patties hereto with or in the
presence of the minor children.
23. Neither party is ordered to pay alimony.
24. Each patty shall pay his/her own attorney fees.
25. Each patty shall execute any document or provide any information
necessary to can-y out the terms of this decree.
26. Alabama law requires each party in this action who has either custody of
or the right of visitation with a child to notify other patties who have custody of or the
right of visitation with the child of any change in his or her address or telephone
number, or both, and of any change or proposed change of principal residence and
telephone number of numbers of a child. This is a continuing duty and remains in effect
as to each child subject to the custody or visitation provisions of this decree until such
child reaches the age of majority or becomes emancipated and for so long as you at·e
entitled to custody of or visitation with a child covered by this order. Ift here is to be a
change of principal residence by you or by a child subject to the custody or visitation
provisions 'of this order, you must provide the following information to each other
person who has custody or visitation rights under this decree as follows:
(1) The intended new residence, including the specific street address, if
known.
(2) The mailing address, if not the same as the street address.
(3) The telephone number or numbers at such residence, if known.
(4) If applicable, the name, address, and telephone number of the school
to be attended by the child, if known.
(5) The date of the intended change of principal residence of a child.
(6) A statement of the specific reasons for the proposed change of
principal residence of a child, if applicable.
(7) A proposal for a revised schedule of custody of or visitation with a
DOCUMENT 156
child, if any.
(8) Unless you are a member of the Armed Forces of the United States
of America and are being transferred or relocated pursuant to a non
voluntary order of the government, a warning to the non-relocating
person that an objection to the relocation must be made within 30
days of the receipt of the notice or the relocation will be permitted.
You must give notice by ce1tified mail of the proposed change of principal
residence on or before the 45th day before a proposed change of principal residence.
If you do not know and cannot reasonably become aware of such information in
sufficient time to provide a 45-day notice, you must give such notice by ceitified mail
11 ot later than the 10th day after the date that you obtain such information.
Your failure to notify the other parties entitled to notice of your intent to
change the principal residence of a child may be taken into account in a modification
of the custody of or visitation with the child.
If you, as the non-relocating patty, do not commence an action seeking a
temporary or pe1manent order to prevent the change of principal residence of a child
within 30 days after receipt of notice of the intent to change the principal residence of
the child, the change of principal residence is authorized.
DONE and ORDERED this the 27th day ofFebruary,2024.
\s\ Steven R. Penyman
Steven R. Perryman Circuit Comt Judge
